meanings.definition: An act or instance of revolting against civil authority or an established government.
meanings.sent1: The insurrections in the city led to chaos and unrest.
meanings.sent2: The history books are filled with stories of insurrections against rulers.
meanings.sent3: The insurrections in the classroom were when the students rebelled against the strict teacher.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for justice sparked an insurrection in her heart against the corrupt system.
meanings.sent5: The image of the insurrections burning down the old regime will forever be etched in our minds.

meanings.definition: A rebellion or uprising against authority or government.
meanings.sent1: The insurrections of the peasants were a cry for freedom.
meanings.sent2: The country faced multiple insurrections during the war.
meanings.sent3: The insurrections of the animals on the farm made for a humorous children's story.
meanings.sent4: The insurrections of nature against human interference are a reminder of our place in the world.
meanings.sent5: The insurrections of the oppressed people shook the foundations of the oppressive regime.
